byline.contributor: Hussein Butoyi contributed reporting from Bujumbura, Burundi, and Marlise Simons from Paris.

abstract: Lower house of Parliament in Burundi votes to withdraw country from International Criminal Court in The Hague; vote follows tribunal's announcement of preliminary investigation into deaths in Burundi during violent street protests, along with political killings; international advocates for justice express fears that other countries might follow in Burundi's footsteps.

headline.print_headline: Burundi Moves to Quit International Criminal Court, Raising Fears of Exodus
headline.main: Raising Fears of a Flight from International Criminal Court, Burundi Heads for Exit

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The country’s lower house of Parliament has voted overwhelmingly to withdraw from the International Criminal Court, something that other nations have threatened to do....
lead_paragraph: The country’s lower house of Parliament has voted overwhelmingly to withdraw from the International Criminal Court, something that other nations have threatened to do.
